Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against several Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Antifungal activity against A.fumigatus, B.cinerea, F.culmorum, F.oxysporum, N.crassa, C.albicans, C.neoformans and S.cerevisiae.

Literature.Title: Cloning and analysis of a cecropin gene from the malaria vector mosquito, Anopheles gambiae.
Literature.Author: Blass C.,Lowenberger C.,Charlet M.,Bulet P.,Vizioli J.

Literature.Title: Genomic organization and regulation of three cecropin genes in Anopheles gambiae.
Literature.Author: Zheng A.L.,Zheng X.-L.

Literature.Title: The genome sequence of the malaria mosquito Anopheles gambiae.
Literature.Author: Charlab R.,Sutton G.G.,Halpern A.,Subramanian G.M.,Holt R.A.

Literature.Title: Patterns of selection in anti-malarial immune genes in malaria vectors: evidence for adaptive evolution in LRIM1 in Anopheles arabiensis.
Literature.Author: Antonio-Nkondjo C.,Awono-Ambene P.H.,Marshall J.C.,Parmakelis A.,Slotman M.A.
